data.title: Replace copy.sh with .build file
data.body:
So with the last PR I separated generation part of the linux installer so that part of the installer can be done on the build server. 

The idea is as following, replace the file: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/Installers/Linux/copy.sh with ".build" file.

Currently copy.sh file is used to copy all the needed files to the Installers/Linux/Installer/, and this folder could be just added to an archive and be given to the user.

data.title: Model docs & fixes
data.body:
Changes:
-Docs for all members in Model
-Sealed modificator added to Model(as in XNA).
-Added new method SetCustomEffect which can be used for quickly apply custom effect to all meshes.
-Restrict constructors(in original XNA it is impossible to use them directly).
-Added missed XNA members CopyBoneTransformsTo and CopyBoneTransformsFrom.

data.title: If content compression fails, write uncompressed
data.body:
LZ4 can sometimes fail with certain input byte streams. If this happens, write out an uncompressed file.

This is up here for testing.  Trying to work out how to write a test suite for this case.

Fixes #3664

data.title: Gtk3 Pipeline
data.body: Because I needed 2nd project for Gtk3 Pipeline I created Pipeline.Gtk3.definition, so if there is a better way to do this I would really like to know.

data.title: Implement GenerateTangentFrames
data.body:
We need someone to implement `ModelProcessor.GenerateTangentFrames`.

You just need to check if `GenerateTangentFrames` is true in `ModelProcessor.ProcessMesh()`:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/2d43afcc304bbcc53d45c2f31471192c8b1daa32/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Processors/ModelProcessor.cs#L149

If so then you need to pass the `MeshContent` into the existing `MeshHelper.CalculateTangentFrames` to do the work...  this method is already implemented.

For bonus points implement `ModelProcessor.SwapWindingOrder`.  Just needs to pass the mesh to `MeshHelper.SwapWindingOrder`.

data.title: MGFX - Set texture parameter ignored?
Texture does not show (its all black)
data.body: I use Visual Studio 2012 and I have two projects one is an XNA Window game and the other one is MonoGame Window. They both use the same x file and my code in both projects is the same. Now in XNA my textures are rendered properly while in MonoGame they are not its all black. Am I doing something wrong

data.title: Missing References Nuget non
data.body:
Steps to replicate.
- Fresh install of Visual Studio 2013
- Fresh install of nuget from codeplex
- Fresh install of MonoGame 3.4
- Download Samples
- Run Platform2D Android

Visual studio loads and I get missing reference exceptions.

I have also tried the NuGet restore... removing the package and readding it.

```
Error   1   This project references NuGet package(s) that are missing on this computer.
 Enable NuGet Package Restore to download them. 
 For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=322105.
 The missing file is ..\..\..\packages\MonoGame.Binaries.3.2.3-alpha\build\MonoAndroid\MonoGame.Binaries.targets.   
D:\Users\Nicholas\Projects\MonoGame\Platformer2D\Platforms\Android\Platformer2D.csproj  143 5   Platformer2D
```

I checked my packages and confirmed that the package was missing. I also checked my MonoGame install folder (in Program Files) and cold not find anything. Please advise.

![monogame](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/125889/7147837/bb7e5978-e2b2-11e4-9679-178ed0809934.png)

data.title: Choose Application bug on Windows / Missing References
data.body: Steps to replicate : 1) Install MonoGame 3 2) Download Samples from Git 3) Open .sln file I am using Windows 8 and Visual Studio Pro 2013 I get a "Choose Application" dialog, please advise. I can manually open the project by dragging the sln file onto visual studio. Once I do that all of my references are missing (even System). No amount of nuget reinstall / restore fixes the issue.

data.title: [DX] Rapid resolution change (HW scaler)
data.body:
One suggestion to keep your frame rate steady is to adapt resolution on the fly.
This technique doesn't work with monogame. The first frame after changing resolution is wrong because the swapchain/Window size doesn't sync with Present. I think we have to record a size change and wait until next Present() to apply it. Probably also separate execution paths that end up to CreateSizeDependentResources based on whether the change comes from a rotation (external) or from the code (internal).
The following code swaps between 1 & 1/2 scale every frame.

> ```
>        f = (f+1)%2;
>        float scale = (f + 1f) / 1f; // swap between x1.0 or x0.5
>        graphics.PreferredBackBufferWidth = (int)(Window.ClientBounds.Width * scale);
>        graphics.PreferredBackBufferHeight = (int)(Window.ClientBounds.Height * scale);
>        graphics.ApplyChanges();
> ```

The first screenshot is half the size while it should scale up and fill the window and look  low res.
The opposite is also true, if you start with x0.5 scale and change to x1 the next frame is the upper-left 1/4 of your game zoomed in.
The second screenshot is Photoshoped to show how the game looks like, in realilty there is flicker.

![scaletohalf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3018589/7123997/ba86adf6-e22e-11e4-812d-0ff77ee67545.jpg)
![psed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3018589/7124221/0b56f5e6-e230-11e4-9365-bf7ac2f2d13e.jpg)

data.title: [Pipeline] click on .mgcb file to open.
data.body: Double clicking on an .mgcb file from the explorer launches the Pipeline.exe but doesn't open the .mgcb, instead it loads the most recent project.

data.title: Crash when rotating Windows 8 device
data.body:
Hi,

from time to time, rotating a Windows 8 device crashes the game.

at PlatformClear in GraphicsDevice.DirectX.cs

```
            if (_currentDepthStencilView.Description.Format != SharpDX.DXGI.Format.D24_UNorm_S8_UInt)
                options &= ~ClearOptions.Stencil;
```

_currentDepthStencilView. seems to be null, even when it's been checked a few moments ago (probably being modified asynchronously)

To reproduce, just run a blank sample in the simulator and start rotating it. Sometimes it takes a while, but sometimes crashes at the first run.

I haven't been able to reproduce it in a 2 months old snapshot, but it may be due to crash randomness.

data.title: MediaPlayer initialization out of ui thread -> crash
data.body:
Hi,

when calling MediaPlayer for the first time when not being on UI thread, the game crashes. CoreWindow.GetForCurrentThread() returns null at MediaPlayer.WME.cs, PlatformInitialize.  

This is probably the same problem as https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/3124

data.title: [WP8] fix memory leak when Resume game
data.body:
ContentManager & ContentReaders create new instances during
AssetReload(). The problem was with SoundEffectReader,
and with Shared resources like VertexBuffer, IndexBuffer,
Effect.

http://community.monogame.net/t/sharpdx-crashing-the-app-after-having-resumed-a-few-times/813/5
#1771
#3048

-Removed useless call of base().
-Removed useless usings.

data.title: Model loading issue - Incorrect type reader index found!
data.body:
I am trying to load fbx model exported from Cinema4D (normally these models works fine) but I am getting this exception:

```
An unhandled exception of type 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentLoadException' occurred in MonoGame.Framework.dll

Additional information: Could not load zvb2/sin/VS16 asset as a non-content file!
```

internal exception is:

```
Incorrect type reader index found!
```

Index is 6, but there are only 6 items in array.

In content compile stage I got this warnings:

```
Warning: Asset zvb2/sin/_10.tif built multiple times with different settings.
```

there are many those warnings for all used textures. When I try to load model without textures, everything is fine, so I think that error is hidden there. I am using latest MonoGame compiled from source. Model for testing can be found there: http://vodacekworks.cz/sin.zip
Any ideas?

data.title: Windows phone 8.1 adcontrol not visible
data.body:
Hi Team,
I am developing a game for windows phone 8.1 and i am using monogame 3.3 for doing the same.
In my gamePage.xaml file I have pubcenter ad-control which does not show up at all. I have given height, width, bg color etc, which are some of the solutions found on the internet but nothing worked.

On further investigation found that SwapChainBackGroundPanel is not supported for windows phone 8.1 and above. I am suspecting this might be the issue. If not I don't know how to proceed further.

Please let me know if you need a sample to replicate the issue.

Is this actually needed for WinGL?  This isn't packaged in the installer currently which is why I ask.

@thefiddler  @cra0zy ??

data.title: Installer VS2015 Support
data.body:
This adds VS2015 support to the installer.  Mainly it just copies the templates for VS2010 desktop projects and VS2013 universal apps.

The next step is full Win10 support.
